para.text: When files are added to the archive structure, ModelArchiver uses the file extension to determine a default description for the the files. If the file is not listed in an archive list, the extension is also used to determine whether the file is an input or output file and the type of model (such as MODFLOW, MODPATH, or ZONEBUDGET (Harbaugh, 1990, 2005, Pollock, 2012)). The choices under Model Files are related to how the file extensions used in the archive and with adding model files to the archive individually.

ModelArchiver has an extensive list of file extensions built into it. These extensions are saved to an initialization file that is loaded each time ModelArchiver is opened and is saved again in ModelArchiver is closed. Thus, changes to the extension list will be available in additional archives created later on the same computer.

Files with the extension ".archive" will have that extension stripped off when creating the archive. This can be helpful when one version of a file is to be stored in the archive but a different version will be used when the model was first created. This capacity can be especially useful for files that list the names of other files. For example a batch file to run the model might include the path to the model program on the computer but in the archive, the model program might be in a different location so a different version of the batch file is required.
